page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: This is an area dominated by farming and its related small industries.The landscape is the traditional English field system bordered by predominantly hawthorn hedges over rolling lowlands. The farming is mainly arable. There are scattered dairy farms, battery chicken and pig units. The population has not greatly changed in recent years.The numbers at Hinstock school have hovered around 70 since the war.Many of the families have links that go back for generations. Expansion of the living accomodation is limited because there is no mains sewerage in the area
